meanings.definition: To get rid of or throw away
meanings.sent1: She disposes of old clothes by donating them to charity.
meanings.sent2: He disposes the trash in the bin every evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat disposes of the unwanted toy by batting it under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The magician disposes of the playing cards with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent5: The gardener disposes of the wilted flowers to make space for new blooms.

meanings.sent1: The manager disposes of customer complaints promptly.
meanings.sent2: She disposes the paperwork before leaving the office.
meanings.sent3: The detective disposes of the case with a surprising twist.
meanings.sent4: The negotiator disposes of the disagreement by finding a middle ground.
meanings.sent5: The teacher disposes of the classroom chaos with a calm demeanor.

meanings.definition: To incline or make someone inclined towards something
meanings.sent1: The enticing aroma disposes customers to try the new dish.
meanings.sent2: He disposes his friends to join him on the adventure.
meanings.sent3: The catchy tune disposes listeners to tap their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her warm smile disposes people to trust her instantly.
meanings.sent5: The inspiring speech disposes the audience to take action for change.
